title: Need help - Garamond-like w Italic Swashes
content:
Cant’ find a perfect match for this Garamond-like with Italic Swashes (may be not a Garamond...). Many thanks in advance.

More details of this specimen in attachment.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706175124im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/caslon-like_4698.gif)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [caslon.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706175124/http:/typophile.com/files/caslon.gif) | 558.74 KB |

 [‹ looks like FF Din light but it's not?!?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706175124/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43838 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font ID - Rapha.cc ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706175124/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43828 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Ryuk

comments.content: Thanks... Yes... Very close to URW Garamond No4 or 5 but where are these italic swashes coming from...? And downer serifs of italic “p” don’t match at all...
yep, you’re right about the swashes, they are much nearer garamond classico
URW Garamond Classico is also close but not a good match for text nor italics/swashes... Seems very hard to find a match...

I was shown other images by Thomas (Ryuk) and it was identified yesterday. It’s [Hoefler Titling](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706175124/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100011).
